Merge pull request #93 from orien/rake_11

Compatibility with Rake 11

Compatibility with Rake 11

TaskManager#last_comment has been removed in Rake 11. We are to migrate
to #last_description. This has been available for many years so
backwards compatibility is not a problem.
Drop 1.9 support

Merge pull request #92 from jaredbeck/support_array_glob

Use Dir.glob instead of Dir.[]

Use Dir.glob instead of Dir.[]

Adds support for passing an array of glob strings to the
following options:

- abc_glob
- style_exclude
- style_glob

Example:

```
cane.style_glob = [
  'app/**/*.{rb,haml,prawn}',
  'config/**/*.rb'
]
```

Using `Dir.[]`, this configuration is not possible.

Merge pull request #87 from loganhasson/master

Update specs to RSpec 2.14.7 syntax (Updated)

Update specs to RSpec 2.14.7 syntax

This conversion is done by Transpec 1.13.1 with the following command:
    transpec

* 112 conversions
    from: obj.should
      to: expect(obj).to

* 66 conversions
    from: == expected
      to: eq(expected)

* 12 conversions
    from: obj.should_receive(:message)
      to: expect(obj).to receive(:message)

* 6 conversions
    from: obj.should_not
      to: expect(obj).not_to

* 1 conversion
    from: -> { }.should
      to: expect { }.to

* 1 conversion
    from: =~ [1, 2]
      to: match_array([1, 2])

Fix style violations

Merge pull request #64 from coffeejunk/ruby2

updates for ruby 2.0

Convert invalid strings from binary to utf-8

Since changing the encoding from UTF8 to UTF8 doesn't do anything (see
http://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/7967#note-1), change the source encoding
to binary (ie. ascii-8bit) and replace all undefined characters.

Fixes #20.
Extract class Cane::File to handle encoding in one place.
Revert a spacing convention I never liked anyway.
Consistent opening of files as UTF-8.

Ignore invalid UTF-8 input when parsing lines.

This continues the hack that cane assumes UTF-8 input, which may not
actually be the case but still seems like a decent option since I don't
have good examples of this not being the case.

This should not add any performance overhead, since input is only
re-encoded if any comparison fails on it. I have not benchmarked whether
this actually a big deal or not, but should.

Fixes #22.

Don't recognize magic encoding comment as class documentation.

The exact spec for this comment is unclear from the Ruby source. There
is exactly one test for a valid comment, and `parse.y` is ... obtuse.
The regex used here was found in `lib/erb.rb` and copied verbatim, with
the exception of a redundant regex to exclude -*- markers, which AFAICT
is entirely unnecessary.

Fixes #21.

Style.

add "cane/rake_task"

For easy creation of rake tasks that run cane.

no need to munge LOAD_PATH

In Rubygems environment, the LOAD_PATH will already be set and there's
no need to add a duplicate to it.

In development or other setups, simply prepare the LOAD_PATH yourself:

  $ RUBYLIB=lib bin/cane

  # or:

  $ ruby -Ilib bin/cane
